intro: Jatropha aculeata, commonly known as the spiny cupplant, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 1 to 2 meters. The plant features distinctive, spiny leaves and produces clusters of yellow flowers that bloom in summer. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that split open to release seeds. Jatropha aculeata is adapted to thrive in disturbed soils and is often found in open areas such as roadsides and fields.
